intro: Dissotis gilgiana var. witteana, commonly known as the Witte's spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks. It has slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The flowers are borne in dense clusters and bloom during the warmer months, attracting various pollinators.
